poem:
**Silent Screening**

A quiet river flows,   
not all reeds are troubled.   
Among the multitudes,   
a genetic whisper speaks –    
selective echoes.   
Deep within, seeds unfound   
by disappointed hands.   
Nature's choice, unseen.   
In the waiting room,   
time marks itself   
on silence like   
petals falling  
one by one.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Expert panel advises against prostate cancer screening for most men in UK Prostate cancer screening should not be made available to the vast majority of men across the UK, a panel of expert government health advisers has said, to the “deep disappointment” of several charities and campaigners. The UK National Screening Committee (UKNSC) has instead recommended that there should be a targeted screening programme for men with a confirmed BRCA1 or BRCA2 faulty gene variant,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
